item.title: Eric add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Eric add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "All of old. Nothing else ever. Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Eric add a quote by Alan Sokal
item.description: "A mode of thought does not become 'critical' simply by attributing that label to itself, but by virtue of its content." -- Alan Sokal

item.title: Eric add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "Like a wind crying endlessly through the universe, Time carries away the names and the deeds of conquerors and commoners alike. And all that we were, all that remains, is in the memories of those who cared we came this way for a brief moment." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Eric add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The trick is not becoming a writer. The trick is staying a writer." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Eric add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Eric add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "I can't go on, I'll go on." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Eric add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "We can judge our progress by the courage of our questions and the depth of our answers, our willingness to embrace what is true rather than what feels good." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Eric add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that. You forget some things, dont you? Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Eric add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "If you make people think they're thinking, they'll love you; but if you really make them think, they'll hate you." -- Harlan Ellison
